body_html:
So this PR got me to try out the cpp extension for setup.py with the maskrcnn cusom ops.
I'm 99.95% happy, just not with the name, which I would like to not pretend its a python extension:
https://github.com/facebookresearch/maskrcnn-benchmark/blob/fa5cd4ea12c29b18ce9895db008a6b1cbdc8303f/setup.py#L75
Other than that, it compiles great in setup.py.

So in my mind, this makes sense in terms of "build custom ops where we used to build extensions", and I'd think one might take this a step further and load the custom ops lib rather than returning the path.
body_text:
So this PR got me to try out the cpp extension for setup.py with the maskrcnn cusom ops.
I'm 99.95% happy, just not with the name, which I would like to not pretend its a python extension:
https://github.com/facebookresearch/maskrcnn-benchmark/blob/fa5cd4ea12c29b18ce9895db008a6b1cbdc8303f/setup.py#L75
Other than that, it compiles great in setup.py.
So in my mind, this makes sense in terms of "build custom ops where we used to build extensions", and I'd think one might take this a step further and load the custom ops lib rather than returning the path.
body:
So this PR got me to try out the cpp extension for setup.py with the maskrcnn cusom ops.
I'm 99.95% happy, just not with the name, which I would like to not pretend its a python extension:
https://github.com/facebookresearch/maskrcnn-benchmark/blob/fa5cd4ea12c29b18ce9895db008a6b1cbdc8303f/setup.py#L75
Other than that, it compiles great in setup.py.

So in my mind, this makes sense in terms of "build custom ops where we used to build extensions", and I'd think one might take this a step further and load the custom ops lib rather than returning the path.
